business_discovery.biography: A great coffee for every taste and mood. Find your next coffee today.
business_discovery.name: Blue Bottle Coffee

data.caption: We are thrilled to introduce a new single origin from a farmer you may recognize from our menus. Brazil Samambaia Yellow Catuai Natural from Fazenda Samambaia farm (fazendasamambaia), owned and operated by Henrique Cambraia, tastes like you’re sipping a bright sunny day. Grapefruit-like brightness accompanies plum and blueberry notes, with a whisper of hibiscus softening the fruit-forward aroma. Don’t miss this taste of summer.
Have you tried our Spiced NOLA yet? What do you think? Colorful commentary welcomed.

Which summer flavors make your mouth water most? Juicy stone fruits? Plump berries? Savory tomatoes and herbs? All the above?⁠
⁠
If you’re craving fresh, seasonal flavors, good news: your favorite cafe now has an updated summer menu!⁠

This week we wanted to feature two cafes in Japan that showcase innovation within the cultural and physical surroundings.

We opened our first Blue Bottle cafe in Tokyo in Kiyosumi in 2015, hoping to add our small part to the specialty coffee culture in Japan that’s inspired us from our earliest days. Opening a roastery in Kiyosumi, one of Tokyo's starker and more industrial corners, felt like a perfect fit for us. Not only were we taken with the passion and dedication of kissaten culture in general, we've also developed a fondness for unknown and exciting urban nooks.

Our Shinjuku cafe started as a hole-in-the-wall coffee stand—and we literally mean hole in the wall. We essentially dug out a space in a wall that was only meant to fit our baristas and their tools. We loved how seamlessly we fit into the surrounding area and found our place within the community, so we decided to add on to our whole-in-the-wall and turn it into a cafe.

The NEW Spiced NOLA—a summer spin on our iconic New Orleans-Style Iced Coffee. Ethiopian clove, cinnamon bark, and black cardamom from Brundo Spice Company transform our creamy chicory cold-brewed classic into an entirely new drink: bright and soft, with a spicy florality. ⁠
⁠
This summer treat is only around for a limited time. Don’t miss out, find one at your nearest cafe!

A little nosh in the park under a blue sky, a NOLA while you lounge in the grass. We’ve been dreaming about picnic season all year long and our picnic blanket from theweavingmill is downright dreamy. ⁠
⁠
The Weaving Mill in Chicago is an artist-run industrial weaving studio. In addition to making bespoke textiles, the Weaving Mill collaborates with artists and designers, offers textile education workshops for adults with developmental disabilities, and hosts an experimental artist residency program. ⁠
⁠
Their unique artistry is woven into this collaboration and each individual picnic blanket, with only 50 blankets in existence. Bring one to all your outdoor events and give your picnics a Blue Bottle touch. ⁠

A few of our cafes are trying something new and delicious. In select Northern California cafes, we will be testing a pilot menu with reimagined toasts, sandwiches, and bites.

From hearty vegan options for breakfast to a brand-new spin on our classic avocado toast, help us decide which of these creations is a favorite! If you’re in Northern California, check your local cafe and see what surprises are on your menu.

Back by popular demand, a Father’s Day favorite from last year—the Blue Bottle Coffee x Timbuk2 Weekender Kit. This all-in-one set comes equipped with a Blue Bottle Dripper and filters, Porlex mini grinder, and a Miir Commuter Cup. ⁠
⁠
The father figures in your life will love the ease and portability. And you’ll love how great they look carrying their waxed canvas bag with leather trim. Make delicious coffee effortless this Father’s Day. ⁠

Our newest single origin comes to you just in time for summer cold brew! This year, we’re roasting Colombia Bilbao Los Vascos specifically for cold brewing. With any cold brew method, you’ll unlock layers of caramel sweetness, bright notes of grapefruit, and soft hints of herbaceous thyme. ⁠
⁠
And the best part? Our Single Origin Cold Brew is so good, it’s here to stay. ⁠

Our latest, and smallest ever, cafe on-the-go is here. We converted a vintage Airstream trailer into a new coffee truck set to travel throughout Korea. First stop? Nodeulseom, an island in the Han river in Seoul. Just like our early days at Bay Area farmer’s markets, our pour overs are on display showcasing our baristas’ talents and the flow of an intentional cup of coffee.

Our Blue Bottle Coffee Truck also offers our New Orleans-Style Iced Coffee, grab-and-go Cold Brew and Coffee Cookies, exclusive merchandise, whole bean coffee, and more.

Visit bluebottlecoffee_korea for more info, and stay tuned for the next stop on the truck’s journey!

Next up in our “Coffee With…” series, we welcome Ryan Upton and Airi Isoda from wrk_shp to chat with us about the countless cafes they've designed for us, their design process and how they find inspiration in every day experiences.

Grab your sunnies and your favorite iced drink and enjoy outside.⁠
⁠
What’s your go-to iced drink on a hot, sunny day? | 📸: toria.webber

Meet the Cold Brew Duo—one blend, one single origin, two organic coffees made especially for cold brewing. ⁠
⁠
Cafe Cold Brew is the iconic blend served in our cafes across the globe with notes of berry, candied lemon, and chocolate, while our Single Origin Cold Brew is a new staple in our cold brew repertoire. ⁠
⁠
The Single Origin Cold Brew is roasted specifically for cold brewing. When brewed cold it unlocks layers of sweet caramel, bright grapefruit, and herbaceous thyme. ⁠
⁠
Tag the other half of your perfect duo in the comments!⁠

Over the last year, we’ve been introducing oat milk as our default milk in pilot cafes across America to help curb our environmental impact. Because you all seem to love it and it’s helping decrease our carbon footprint, we are now serving oat milk as the default milk in all cafes across the country. We will still offer milk and other milk alternatives for those who prefer something else. ⁠
⁠
Join us in celebrating with an oat milk NOLA and learn more about our environmental goals on our blog, link in bio.

We put coffee center stage at our cafes, that’s why—more often than not—you’ll find the coffee bar smack dab in the middle of any Blue Bottle cafe you visit. Here is a look at our favorite focal point in a few of our international cafes.

Set among the pine trees, mountains and ambling coastline of Jeju Island in South Korea, this first cafe was created to complement the natural beauty surrounding it by offering bright open spaces.

On the contrary, our Seongsu cafe, set in an industrial pocket of Seoul, harnesses the raw power of the city with red brick and concrete features. From the street level, you first encounter our roastery against the backdrop of high rises and trains. In the cafe down below, our baristas craft drinks set on a stage with guests able to view them from the above terraces.

Our Kobe cafe in Japan shimmers with brass details, paying homage to the region’s centuries-old maritime history. Our tall wooden and brass bar resembles the handcrafted ships that once anchored in the nearby bay.

Which cafe do you see yourself in—coffee and book in hand?

Our NOLA Decaf Whole Beans are here! This coffee is perfect for brewing New Orleans-style Iced Coffee any time of day. So as the days stay hot, you can sip your favorite sweet treat into the evenings without any of the caffeine.
thecarolinelin making coffee runs look flawless

Our newest single origin, Peru Puno Juan Quilla Laura, is a treasure from the hillside shores of Lake Titicaca. In the southern region of Puno, Juan used washed processing to create a sweet, yet nuanced cup from the Bourbon cultivar. This coffee really stands out for its complex aroma that deepens the coffee’s sweetness. Rose hips, lemongrass, and other herbaceous notes on the nose add dimension to this classic South American coffee.

Whenever possible, we seek out buildings with history to house our cafes. We believe in being rooted in the communities we serve and preserving the history that’s come before us. W. C. Morse and Mint Plaza are a few of our cafes that sit right at the intersection of preservation and innovation.

Oakland’s W. C. Morse cafe lives at the heart of Blue Bottle Coffee. Our personal history starts in the Temescal neighborhood, just blocks from this cafe, where James first roasted our coffee. In our early days we stumbled upon the historic W. C. Morse building when longtime Blue Bottle illustrator Michelle Ott was biking past and snapped a photo of what was formerly the East Bay’s first-ever truck showroom—an aspect that inspired our interior design.

In San Francisco’s historic 1912 Provident Loan Association building, our Mint Plaza cafe can feel larger than life with its classic architecture and design. The staggering 17-foot ceilings were grand enough to inspire our 17 Ft Ceiling Espresso served exclusively at Mint Plaza and sold online. We add to its enchantment with our three-light siphon bar that may look like a mad science laboratory—but we promise it delivers great coffee. The rest is history. 

Photo Credits: marikoreed courtesy of jensen_architects | abryanphoto
We wanted to wish every mother figure a relaxing, slowed-down Mother’s Day—starting with great coffee, ending with your feet up, and filled with happiness all the way through 💙⁠

In all of our cafes across the globe, we use this blend to create rich and smooth cold brew year-round. ⁠
⁠
No matter how you like your cold brew, our Cafe Cold Brew will hit the spot. The clear fruit notes and radiant brightness shine when served black, over ice. Add a splash of your favorite milk, and it blossoms into chocolatey luxury.⁠
⁠
It’s our first choice, our shining star, our everything when it comes to cold brew.⁠

We’ve partnered with hidden.ny for their first-ever storefront powered by shopify. 

Starting tomorrow, HIDDEN is bringing a pop up shop to the Lower East Side. Look for the Blue Bottle x Hidden Coffee Shop to snag a NOLA iced coffee—on us.

May 6–8, 12 pm – 5 pm daily.
48 Ludlow St, New York, NY

Hurry in, our NOLAs are limited and we don’t want you to miss out.

We see coffee as more than just a morning wake up call, but something that inspires creativity and innovation. To explore this, we sat down with renowned michelinguide chefs Cédric Vongerichten (cedvongerichten) and his father Jean-Georges (chefjgv) to hear how they’re breaking boundaries in the culinary world. Watch to find out why it's easier to open a new restaurant than change a menu, and who’s more difficult to work with in the kitchen.

We love to see you enjoying some of the more unconventional aspects of our cafes, like this outdoor bar top at our Aoyama cafe in Tokyo. ⁠
⁠
We’re always dreaming up new ways to make our cafes special and bring new locations exciting twists. We’d love to hear where you think our next cafe will be!⁠
⁠
 📸: xx_cafe_cafe_xx

Spoil the mother figures in your life with permission to slow down and savor the moment.

We’ve put together a heavenly bundle. All that’s left for you to do is send off this Coffee, Chocolate, and Mug Set with love.

What treats to expect? Our comforting Bella Donovan blend for days of dreamy mornings. A double-walled glass mug to keep her coffee hot and lovely to admire. Plus, mouthwatering 70% Virunga dark chocolate: pairs perfectly with Bella. (Because … dessert for breakfast.)

Inspired by our baristas, we partnered with industryofallnations to create an apron made with sustainable integrity and a simple but modern look that brings the #BlueBottleCoffee feel to your kitchen.

Through elimination of fabric waste, water-saving production techniques, and all-natural, upcycled (and biodegradable!) fabric this apron does more than just looks great. Learn more about our environmentally-focused collaboration and all the ways this apron benefits the planet via the link in bio.

You’ve supported our sustainability goals since 2002, when James Freeman roasted the first Blue Bottle coffee blends: certified organic, stored in stainless steel stockpots, packaged in Kraft paper bags.

Today, climate change is escalating. Time for bigger pivots, more scalable change.

That’s why we’re committed: carbon neutrality by 2024.

Thank you for joining us as we learn and grow — from testing oat milk as the default in pilot cafes to compensating for greenhouse gas emissions for each US order from us to you.

Happy Earth Day. Here’s to taking action every day. It all matters.

It feels like brunch weather in the Bay to us. Soak up these warm weekends at a Blue Bottle Coffee cafe with your favorite coffee and a bite from our new spring menu. Check our stories to see which cafes in the Bay Area are reopening for some Springtime bliss. |📸: tjddus__cafe

Our latest Exceedingly Rare coffee is unlike any other from Sumatra.⁠
⁠
Each sip as refreshing as slicing open a fresh tropical fruit. Buoyant. Unexpected. Entirely transporting. Naturally processed. Limited-release. Our favorite lot from the first-ever Indonesia Cup of Excellence competition. Exceedingly Rare, indeed.⁠
⁠
It’s unique coffees like this Sumatra that helped make Blue Bottle Coffee the Official Coffee of the michelinguide US.

Our newest Exceedingly Rare coffee is here: Sumatra Aceh Avatara Gayo COE # 7. One sip and you’ll easily see why judges in the first-ever Indonesia Cup of Excellence competition fell under its spell.

This year, Blue Bottle is the Official Coffee of michelinguide. To showcase this coffee, we invited renowned MICHELIN chefs Cédric (cedvongerichten) and Jean-Georges Vongerichten (chefjgv) to expand on the coffee’s expressive flavor using their intimate knowledge of Indonesian cuisine.

Watch the video to see their innovative take on culinary pairings featuring this exquisite coffee, and order yours today.
